maml:description.maml:para: Adds new deployment regions to a PsApiManagement instance.

The Add-AzureRmApiManagementRegion cmdlet adds new instance of type PsApiManagementRegion to the collection of AdditionalRegions of provided instance of type Microsoft.Azure.Commands.ApiManagement.Models.PsApiManagement . This cmdlet does not deploy anything by itself but updates instance of PsApiManagement in-memory. To update a deployment of an API Management pass the modified PsApiManagement Instance to Update-AzureRmApiManagementDeployment.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the PsApiManagement instance that this cmdlet adds additional deployment regions to.
Specifies the location of the new deployment region.
Specifies the tier of the deployment region. Valid values are:
Specifies the SKU capacity of the deployment region.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies the PsApiManagement instance that this cmdlet adds additional deployment regions to.
Specifies the location of the new deployment region.
Specifies the tier of the deployment region. Valid values are:
Specifies the SKU capacity of the deployment region.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:

maml:alert.maml:para: The cmdlet writes updated PsApiManagement * instance to pipeline.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Add new deployment regions to a PsApiManagement instance

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command adds two premium SKU units and the region named East US to the PsApiManagement instance.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Add new deployment regions to a PsApiManagement instance and then update deployment

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets a PsApiManagement object, adds two premium SKU units for the region named East US, and then updates deployment.

maml:description.maml:para: Backs up an API Management service.
The Backup-AzureRmApiManagement cmdlet backs up an instance of an Azure API Management service. This cmdlet stores the backup as an Azure Storage blob.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the of resource group under which the API Management deployment exists.
Specifies the name of the API Management deployment that this cmdlet backs up.
Specifies the name of the container of the blob for the backup. If the container does not exist, this cmdlet creates it.
Specifies the name of the blob for the backup. If the blob does not exist, this cmdlet creates it. This cmdlet generates a default value based on the following pattern:
Indicates that this cmdlet returns the backed up PsApiManagement object, if the operation succeeds.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies the name of the of resource group under which the API Management deployment exists.
Specifies the name of the API Management deployment that this cmdlet backs up.
Specifies the name of the container of the blob for the backup. If the container does not exist, this cmdlet creates it.
Specifies the name of the blob for the backup. If the blob does not exist, this cmdlet creates it. This cmdlet generates a default value based on the following pattern:
Indicates that this cmdlet returns the backed up PsApiManagement object, if the operation succeeds.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Back up an API Management service

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command backs up an API Management service to a Storage blob.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets a list or a particular API Management Service description.
The Get-AzureRmApiManagement cmdlet gets a list of all API Management services under subscription or specified resource group or a particular API Management.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the resource group under in which this cmdlet gets the API Management service.
Specifies the name of API Management service.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies the name of the resource group under in which this cmdlet gets the API Management service.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies the name of the resource group under in which this cmdlet gets the API Management service.
Specifies the name of API Management service.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get all API Management services

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets all API Management services within a subscription.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Get all API Management services by a specific name

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets all API Management service by name.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets a link with an SSO token to a deployed management portal of an API Management service.
The Get-AzureRmApiManagementSsoToken cmdlet returns a link (URL) containing a single sign-on (SSO) token to a deployed management portal of an API Management service.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of resource group under which API Management exists.
Specifies the name of the API Management instance.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies the name of resource group under which API Management exists.
Specifies the name of the API Management instance.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get the SSO token of an API Management service

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the SSO token of an API Management service.

maml:description.maml:para: Imports a certificate in a PFX format for an API Management Service.
The Import-AzureRmApiManagementHostnameCertificate cmdlet imports a certificate in a PFX format for an API Management Service. The certificate is to be used for custom hostnames configuration.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the of resource group under which the API Management deployment exists.
Specifies the name of the API Management deployment that this cmdlet imports.
Specifies the host name type that this cmdlet loads the certificate for.
Specifies the path to a .pfx certificate file.
Specifies the password for the .pfx certificate file.
Returns an object representing the item with which you are working. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies the name of the of resource group under which the API Management deployment exists.
Specifies the name of the API Management deployment that this cmdlet imports.
Specifies the host name type that this cmdlet loads the certificate for.
Specifies the path to a .pfx certificate file.
Specifies the password for the .pfx certificate file.
Returns an object representing the item with which you are working. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Import a API Management hostname certificate

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command imports a certificate for a proxy custom hostname.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates an API Management deployment.
The New-AzureRmApiManagement cmdlet creates an API Management deployment in Azure API Management.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the of resource group under which this cmdlet creates an API Management deployment.
Specifies a name for the API Management deployment.
Specifies the location in which this cmdlet creates an API Management deployment. To obtain valid locations, use the Get-AzureLocation cmdlets.
Specifies the name of an organization. API Management uses this address in the developer portal in email notifications.
Specifies the originating email address for all notifications that the API Management system sends.
Specifies the tier of the API Management service. Valid values are:
Specifies the SKU capacity of the Azure API Management service. The default is one (1).
Virtual Network Type of the ApiManagement Deployment. Valid Values are - "None" (Default Value. ApiManagement is not part of any Virtual Network")
- "External" (ApiManagement Deployment is setup inside a Virtual Network having an Internet Facing Endpoint)
- "Internal" (ApiManagement Deployment is setup inside a Virtual Network having an Intranet Facing Endpoint)
Virtual Network Configuration of master Azure API Management deployment region.
Additional deployment regions of Azure API Management.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies the name of the of resource group under which this cmdlet creates an API Management deployment.
Specifies a name for the API Management deployment.
Specifies the location in which this cmdlet creates an API Management deployment. To obtain valid locations, use the Get-AzureLocation cmdlets.
Specifies the name of an organization. API Management uses this address in the developer portal in email notifications.
Specifies the originating email address for all notifications that the API Management system sends.
Specifies the tier of the API Management service. Valid values are:
Specifies the SKU capacity of the Azure API Management service. The default is one (1).
Virtual Network Type of the ApiManagement Deployment. Valid Values are - "None" (Default Value. ApiManagement is not part of any Virtual Network")
- "External" (ApiManagement Deployment is setup inside a Virtual Network having an Internet Facing Endpoint)
- "Internal" (ApiManagement Deployment is setup inside a Virtual Network having an Intranet Facing Endpoint)
Virtual Network Configuration of master Azure API Management deployment region.
Additional deployment regions of Azure API Management.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Create a Developer tier API Management service

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a Developer tier API Management service. The command specifies the organization and the administrator address. The command does not specify the SKU parameter. Therefore, the cmdlet uses the default value of Developer.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Create a Standard tier service that has three units

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a Standard tier API Management service that has three units.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Create an API Management service for an external virtual network
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $virtualNetwork = New-AzureRmApiManagementVirtualNetwork -Location "West US" -SubnetResourceId "/subscriptions/a8ff56dc-3bc7-4174-b1e8-3726ab15d0e2/resourceGroups/ContosoGroup/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/westUsVirtualNetwork/subnets/backendSubnet" PS C:\> New-AzureRmApiManagement -ResourceGroupName "ContosoGroup" -Location "West US" -Name "ContosoApi" -Organization Contoso -AdminEmail admin@contoso.com -VirtualNetwork $virtualNetwork -VpnType "External" -Sku "Premium"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a Premium-tier API Management service in an Azure virtual network subnet having an external-facing gateway endpoint with a master region in the West US.

command:example.maml:title: Example 4: Create an API Management service for an internal virtual network
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $virtualNetwork = New-AzureRmApiManagementVirtualNetwork -Location "West US" -SubnetResourceId "/subscriptions/a8ff56dc-3bc7-4174-b1e8-3726ab15d0e2/resourceGroups/ContosoGroup/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/westUsVirtualNetwork/subnets/backendSubnet" PS C:\> New-AzureRmApiManagement -ResourceGroupName "ContosoGroup" -Location "West US" -Name "ContosoApi" -Organization "Contoso" -AdminEmail "admin@contoso.com" -VirtualNetwork $virtualNetwork -VpnType "Internal" -Sku "Premium"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a Premium-tier API Management service in an Azure virtual network subnet having an internal-facing gateway endpoint with a master region in the West US.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates an instance of PsApiManagementHostnameConfiguration.

The New-AzureRmApiManagementHostnameConfiguration cmdlet is a helper command that creates an instance of PsApiManagementHostnameConfiguration . This command is used with the Set-AzureRmApiManagementHostnames cmdlet.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the certificate thumbprint. The certificate must be first imported with the Import-AzureRmApiManagementHostnameCertificate cmdlet.
Specifies the custom host name for which this cmdlet creates the PsApiManagementHostnameConfiguration instance.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies the certificate thumbprint. The certificate must be first imported with the Import-AzureRmApiManagementHostnameCertificate cmdlet.
Specifies the custom host name for which this cmdlet creates the PsApiManagementHostnameConfiguration instance.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Create and initialize an instance of PsApiManagementHostnameConfiguration

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates and initializes an instance of PsApiManagementHostnameConfiguration .

maml:description.maml:para: Creates an instance of PsApiManagementRegion.
Helper command to create an instance of PsApiManagementRegion. This command is to be used with New-AzureRmApiManagement command.

maml:Description.maml:para: Location of the additional deployment region.
Sku capacity of the Azure API Management service additional region. Default value is 1.
Virtual Network Configuration of Azure API Management deployment region. Default value is $null.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Location of the additional deployment region.
Sku capacity of the Azure API Management service additional region. Default value is 1.
Virtual Network Configuration of Azure API Management deployment region. Default value is $null.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$apimRegion = New-AzureRmApiManagementRegion -Location "Central US"
$additionalRegions = @($apimRegion)
New-AzureRmApiManagement -ResourceGroupName ContosoGroup -Location "West US" -Name ContosoApi -Organization Contoso -AdminEmail admin@contoso.com -AdditionalRegions $additionalRegions -Sku "Premium"

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$apimRegionVirtualNetwork = New-AzureRmApiManagementVirtualNetwork -Location "Central US" -SubnetResourceId "/subscriptions/a8ff56dc-3bc7-4174-a1e8-3726ab15d0e2/resourceGroups/ContosoGroup/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/centralusvirtualNetwork/subnets/backendSubnet"
$apimRegion = New-AzureRmApiManagementRegion -Location "Central US" -VirtualNetwork $apimRegionVirtualNetwork
$additionalRegions = @($apimRegion)
$virtualNetwork = New-AzureRmApiManagementVirtualNetwork -Location "West US" -SubnetResourceId "/subscriptions/a8ff56dc-3bc2-4174-a1e8-3726ab15d0e2/resourceGroups/ContosoGroup/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/westUsVirtualNetwork/subnets/backendSubnet"
New-AzureRmApiManagement -ResourceGroupName ContosoGroup -Location "West US" -Name ContosoApi -Organization Contoso -AdminEmail admin@contoso.com -AdditionalRegions $additionalRegions -VirtualNetwork $virtualNetwork -VpnType "External" -Sku "Premium"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates an ApiManagement service of External VpnType in West US Region, with an Additional Region in Central US.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates an instance of PsApiManagementVirtualNetwork.

The New-AzureRmApiManagementVirtualNetwork cmdlet is a helper command to create an instance of PsApiManagementVirtualNetwork . This command is used with Set-AzureRMApiManagementVirtualNetworks cmdlet.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the location of the virtual network in which this cmdlet creates the instance.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies the subnet resource ID of the virtual network.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies the location of the virtual network in which this cmdlet creates the instance.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies the subnet resource ID of the virtual network.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Create a virtual network
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$VirtualNetworks = @() PS C:\> $VirtualNetworks += New-AzureRmApiManagementVirtualNetwork -Location "East US" -SubtenName "ContosoNet" -VnetId "089D3F4D-B986-4DFD-9259-9112BA7A1F03" PS C:\> Set-AzureRmApiManagementVirtualNetworks -ResourceGroupName "ContosoGroup" -Name "ContosoApi" -VirtualNetworks $VirtualNetworks

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example creates a virtual network and then calls the Set-AzureRmApiManagementVirtualNetworks cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes an API Management service.
The Remove-AzureRmApiManagement cmdlet removes an Azure API Management service.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the of resource group under which the API Management deployment exists.
Specifies the name of the API Management deployment that this cmdlet removes.
Indicates that this cmdlet returns a value of $True if the operation succeeds.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies the name of the of resource group under which the API Management deployment exists.
Specifies the name of the API Management deployment that this cmdlet removes.
Indicates that this cmdlet returns a value of $True if the operation succeeds.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Remove an API Management service

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes the API Management service named ContosoApi.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes an existing deployment region from PsApiManagement instance.

The Remove-AzureRmApiManagementRegion cmdlet removes instance of type Microsoft.Azure.Commands.ApiManagement.Models.PsApiManagementRegion from a collection of AdditionalRegions of provided the instance of type Microsoft.Azure.Commands.ApiManagement.Models.PsApiManagement . This cmdlet does not modify deployment by itself but updates the instance of PsApiManagement in-memory. To update a deployment of an API Management, pass the modified PsApiManagementInstance to Update-AzureRmApiManagement .

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the PsApiManagement instance that this cmdlet removes the additional deployment region from.
Specifies the location of the region that this cmdlet removes.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies the PsApiManagement instance that this cmdlet removes the additional deployment region from.
Specifies the location of the region that this cmdlet removes.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Remove a region from a PsApiManagement instance

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes the region named East US from the PsApiManagement instance.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Remove a region from a PsApiManagement instance using a series of commands
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-AzureRmApiManagement -ResourceGroupName "Contoso" -Name ContosoApi | Remove-AzureRmApiManagementRegion -Location "East US" | Update-AzureRmApiManagementDeployment

dev:remarks.maml:para: This first command gets an instance of PsApiManagement from the resource group named Contoso named ContosoApi. The final command then removes the region named East US from that instance then updates the deployment.

maml:description.maml:para: Restores an API Management Service from the specified Azure storage blob.
The Restore-AzureRmApiManagement cmdlet restores an API Management Service from the specified backup residing in an Azurestorage blob.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of resource group under which API Management exists.
Specifies the name of the API Management instance that this cmdlet restores.
Specifies the name of the Azure storage backup source container.
Specifies the name of the Azure storage backup source blob.
Returns an object representing the item with which you are working. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies the name of resource group under which API Management exists.
Specifies the name of the API Management instance that this cmdlet restores.
Specifies the name of the Azure storage backup source container.
Specifies the name of the Azure storage backup source blob.
Returns an object representing the item with which you are working. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Restore an API Management service

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command restores an API Management service from Azure storage blob.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets a custom hostname configuration for an API Management service proxy or portal.
The Set-AzureRmApiManagementHostnames cmdlet applies a custom hostname configuration for an API Management service proxy or portal.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the resource group under which the API Management instance exists.
Specifies the name of the API Management instance.
Specifies the custom portal hostname configuration. Passing $null to the cmdlet sets the default hostname.
Specifies the custom proxy hostname configuration. Passing $null sets the default hostname.
Returns an object representing the item with which you are working. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Returns an object representing the item with which you are working. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
Specifies the PsApiManagement instance that this cmdlet gets the PortalHostnameConfiguration and ProxyHostnameConfiguration parameters from.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies the name of the resource group under which the API Management instance exists.
Specifies the name of the API Management instance.
Specifies the custom portal hostname configuration. Passing $null to the cmdlet sets the default hostname.
Specifies the custom proxy hostname configuration. Passing $null sets the default hostname.
Returns an object representing the item with which you are working. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
Specifies the PsApiManagement instance that this cmdlet gets the PortalHostnameConfiguration and ProxyHostnameConfiguration parameters from.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Set the custom hostname configuration for a proxy and portal

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command sets the custom hostname configuration for proxy and portal.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Configure a custom hostname for a proxy and portal
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Import-AzureRmApiManagementHostnameCertificate -Name ContosoApi -ResourceGroupName "Contoso" -HostnameType "Proxy" -PfxPath "C:\proxycert.pfx" -PfxPassword "CertSecret" PS C:\> Import-AzureRmApiManagementHostnameCertificate -Name "ContosoApi" -ResourceGroupName "Contoso" -HostnameType "Portal" -PfxPath "C:\portalcert.pfx" -PfxPassword "CertSecret" PS C:\> $PortalHostnameConf = New-AzureRmApiManagementHostnameConfiguration -Hostname "portal.contoso.com" -CertificateThumbprint "33CC47C6FCA848DC9B14A6F071C1EF7C" PS C:\> $ProxyHostnameConf = New-AzureRmApiManagementHostnameConfiguration -Hostname "proxy.contoso.com" -CertificateThumbprint "5DD7CCF6A1E74E0987DD2873406B7264" PS C:\> Set-AzureRmApiManagementHostnames -Name "ContosoApi" -ResourceGroupName "Contoso" -PortalHostnameConfiguration $PortalHostnameConf -ProxyHostnameConfiguration $ProxyHostnameConf

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example configures a custom hostname for proxy and portal. You need to import corresponding certificates and then apply the custom hostnames.

maml:description.maml:para: Updates deployment of an API Management Service.
The Update-AzureRmApiManagementDeployment cmdlet updates current deployments of an API Management service.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of resource group under which API Management exists.
Specifies the name of API Management that this cmdlet updates.
Specifies the location of the master API Management deployment region.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies the tier of the master Azure API Management deployment region.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies the SKU capacity of the master Azure API Management deployment region.
Specifies the Virtual Network configuration of the master Azure API Management deployment region.
Specifies additional deployment regions of Azure API Management.
Returns an object representing the item with which you are working. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
Specifies the virtual network Type of the API Management deployment. The acceptable values for this parameter are:

- None. The API Management deployment is not part of any Virtual Network. This is the default value. - External. The API Management deployment has an external facing virtual address. - Internal. The API Management deployment has an intranet facing virtual address.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Returns an object representing the item with which you are working. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
Specifies the PsApiManagement instance to get deployment configuration from. Use this parameter if the instance already has all the required changes.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies the name of resource group under which API Management exists.
Specifies the name of API Management that this cmdlet updates.
Specifies the location of the master API Management deployment region.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies the tier of the master Azure API Management deployment region.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies the SKU capacity of the master Azure API Management deployment region.
Specifies the Virtual Network configuration of the master Azure API Management deployment region.
Specifies additional deployment regions of Azure API Management.
Returns an object representing the item with which you are working. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
Specifies the PsApiManagement instance to get deployment configuration from. Use this parameter if the instance already has all the required changes.
Specifies the virtual network Type of the API Management deployment. The acceptable values for this parameter are:

- None. The API Management deployment is not part of any Virtual Network. This is the default value. - External. The API Management deployment has an external facing virtual address. - Internal. The API Management deployment has an intranet facing virtual address.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Update a deployment of an ApiManagement instance

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command updates deployment of an API Management instance to a three unit capacity standard.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Get an ApiManagement instance and rescale it
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$ApiManagement = Get-AzureRmApiManagement -ResourceGroupName "Contoso" -Name "ContosoApi" PS C:\> $ApiManagement.Sku = "Premium" PS C:\> $ApiManagement.Capacity = 5 PS C:\> $ApiManagement.AddRegion("Central US", "Premium", 3) PS C:\> Update-AzureRmApiManagementDeployment -ApiManagement $ApiManagement

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example gets an Api Management instance, scales it to five premium units and then adds an additional three units to the premium region.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Update deployment (external VNET)
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $virtualNetwork = New-AzureRmApiManagementVirtualNetwork -Location "East US" -SubnetResourceId "/subscriptions/a8ff56dc-3bc7-4174-a1e8-3726ab15d0e2/resourceGroups/Api-Default-West-US/providers/Microsoft.ClassicNetwork/virtualNetworks/dfVirtualNetwork/subnets/backendSubnet" PS C:\> Update-AzureRmApiManagementDeployment -ResourceGroupName "ContosoGroup" -Name "ContosoApi" -VirtualNetwork $virtualNetwork -VpnType "External"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command updates an existing API Management deployment and joins to an external VpnType .

command:example.maml:title: Example 4: Update deployment (internal VNET)
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $virtualNetwork = New-AzureRmApiManagementVirtualNetwork -Location "East US" -SubnetResourceId "/subscriptions/a8ff56dc-3bc7-4174-a1e8-3726ab15d0e2/resourceGroups/Api-Default-West-US/providers/Microsoft.ClassicNetwork/virtualNetworks/dfVirtualNetwork/subnets/backendSubnet" PS C:\> Update-AzureRmApiManagementDeployment -ResourceGroupName "ContosoGroup" -Name "ContosoApi" -VirtualNetwork $virtualNetwork -VpnType "Internal"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command updates an existing API Management deployment and joins to an internal VpnType .

maml:description.maml:para: Updates existing deployment region in PsApiManagement instance.

The Update-AzureRmApiManagementRegion cmdlet updates an existing instance of type Microsoft.Azure.Commands.ApiManagement.Models.PsApiManagementRegion in a collection of AdditionalRegions objects of a provided instance of type Microsoft.Azure.Commands.ApiManagement.Models.PsApiManagement . This cmdlet does not deploy anything but updates an instance of PsApiManagement in-memory. To update a deployment of an API Management use the modified PsApiManagementInstance to the Update-AzureRmApiManagementDeployment cmdlet.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the PsApiManagement instance to update an existing deployment region in.
Specifies the location of the deployment region to update.
Specifies the new tier value for the deployment region.
Specifies the new SKU capacity value for the deployment region.
Specifies a virtual network configuration for the deployment region. Passing $null will remove virtual network configuration for the region.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies the PsApiManagement instance to update an existing deployment region in.
Specifies the location of the deployment region to update.
Specifies the new tier value for the deployment region.
Specifies the new SKU capacity value for the deployment region.
Specifies a virtual network configuration for the deployment region. Passing $null will remove virtual network configuration for the region.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
